CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1961, pg. 6, reads: "Triumph Church - This window-shattered edifice, located at 40 Arthur St., and formerly occupied by John Wesley AME Zion Church, is the headquarters for Triumph the Church and Kingdom of God in Christ, a sect presided over by Bishop Daniel H. Harris of 7122 Campania St. This church is due to assume management of properties formerly controlled by DePaul Smith and associates. - Harris Photos."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "Smith Filled Need Ignored by Public?  Editor's note: While Pittsburgh (The Renaissance City) proudly displays its renovation of the Golden Triangle, highlights by the $22 million Civic Arena, to its many citizens and visitors, and maps magnificent plans for 'urban renewal, it has 'swept under the rug its 'dregs of human misery' - those displaced persons, a majority of whom are Negroes, who either have not been relocated or are unable to find suitable housing on their own.  Crack Courier reporter Phyl Garland has gone behind the scenes to interview and write about these 'Prisoners of the Ghetto' and their vicious 'jailer.'  This is the third in a series of articles which The Courier offers its readers..."
TitMainTitle: Triumph the Church and Kingdom of God In Christ, 40 Arthur Street, Hill District
